send out.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to make a person or a group of people or things go from one place to various other places
send out.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Information was sent out to interested students.
Search parties were sent out to look for survivors.
send out.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to broadcast or produce a signal, light, sound etc
send out.translation[0].definitions[1].e: The ship is sending out an SOS signal.
send out.translation[0].definitions[2].d: to ask a restaurant or food shop to deliver food to you at home or at work
send out.translation[1].definitions[0].d: to send things from a central place to various other places
send out.translation[1].definitions[0].e: The bank will be sending out details to all its customers.
Once your business cards are printed, start sending them out as soon as possible.
